p.a: Our Campus is Closed - Stay Safe and Stay Well | Visit our COVID-19 page for updates, resources, and Distance Learning Information

div.p: For the past twelve years the Junior High School has been named a New York State high performing school and “School to Watch" by the NYS Education Department.
Size of the VCS campus in acres.
High school students graduated with Regents Diploma in 2019.
Fall and Winter athletic teams were scholar athletes, maintaining a 90% or higher team average.
After school clubs in high school.
Victor Central School's SAT scores were among the highest in Greater Rochester Area.
The NYS Sportswriters Association has named VCS's Athletic Program the 2018 Kerr Cup Champion.
Students that were inducted into the prestigious Tri-M Music Society in the 2017-2018 school year.
Our Mission:To Teach, To Learn, To Support, To Improve, To Achieve!

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Budget Message From Superintendent Tim Terranova 4.18.20

div.p: While we continue to navigate the challenges related to COVID-19, we must also continue to operate our school district. A major focus moving forward is our school budget. Our District has experienced tremendous growth over the past 15 years, and funding has not kept pace with that growth. Specifically, we have the lowest per-pupil expenditure (total budget divided by # of students) in the entire state of NY, which impacts staffing in several areas as well as our ability to maintain appropriate savings (Reserves). In March, we communicated that we would be proposing a tax-cap override as a way to increase revenue to maintain the excellence for which our District is known.

Since we introduced this information, our community has experienced the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, both from a health and safety standpoint and an economic standpoint. At the April 16, 2020 Board of Education meeting, the District proposed a tentative budget that exceeded the tax cap but not at the level proposed in March. You can learn more about the budget by viewing a video from our discussion HERE.

The Board of Education would like your feedback regarding the VCSD budgetary plan. Please click HERE to enter our ThoughtExchange and submit feedback. The ThoughtExchange will be open through Wednesday afternoon. We will use your feedback to shape the discussion at our Virtual Town Hall (hosted on our District Facebook page) discussion on the budget on April 22, 2020, starting at 6:30 PM.
Thanks again for your continued engagement in our school community.
School buildings will remain closed through May 15th. Distance learning and food distribution will occur during this time.
